lead_paragraph: Today's idea: The telephone call as we know it "deserves to die," a commentator says, because new forms of communication -- texting, chatting and social-network messaging -- are more efficient. Yet it will probably evolve and survive.
snippet: Monday | Today's idea: The telephone call as we know it "deserves to die," a commentator says, because new forms of communication -- texting, chatting and social-network messaging -- are more efficient. Yet it will probably evolve and survive....

headline.main: The Phone Call, Dead or on Hold?

abstract: Monday | Today's idea: The telephone call as we know it "deserves to die," a commentator says, because new forms of communication -- texting, chatting and social-network messaging -- are more efficient. Yet it will probably evolve and survive. [Wired]
